sentences: Tallinnast Viru poole kutsuti laeva vaimu haldjaks.
context: The word 'pahad' is the plural form of the Estonian adjective 'paha', which means bad or evil. In the context provided, it appears in the phrase 'Head ja pahad haldjad' meaning 'Good and bad spirits/supernatural beings'. The word refers to malevolent supernatural entities in Estonian folklore, contrasting with good spirits or guardians (haldjas).
